results.title: The Search for meaning
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Norton
results.brief_description: Presented by Caroline Jones, whose compassionate questioning elicits responses of great honesty, this program features well-known Australians talking about their search for meaning. Guests include, Maina Gielgud - Artistic Director of the Australian Ballet; Stan Arneil - ex-prisoner-of- war; Rene Rivkin - business tycoon; ceramic artist Cybele Rowe; psychologist Dr. Ron Farmer; and naturopath, Dorothy Hall.

results.title: The Search for gravity waves
results.creator_credit: Richard Smith and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Copied from an ABC Television broadcast on 5/12/90. Copyright reference number M007653T. When waves of gravity were fist predicted to be flooding the universe, they were thought to be undetectable. This program examines what gravity waves are, where they originate from, and how they are generated. Explores these and more questions including is a brief look at the effects on gravity of exploding supernovae, binary stars and the formation of black holes.

results.title: The Search for alternative life-styles and philosophies
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications, J. Gary Mitchell and Ronald Fisher
results.brief_description: Explores some of the efforts being made by people searching for personal harmony and fulfilling lifestyle. Looks at a yoga based commune and at individuals studying Zen, Tai Chi, TM and biofeedback.

results.title: The Seamless web
results.creator_credit: Osborn Segerberg, Peter Hollander, University of the State of New York and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Examines the relationship between human beings and the environment and the choices that must be made to preserve it, considered in light of the interconnection between all parts of life in the total environment.

results.title: The Seals of Macquarie Island
results.brief_description: The film shows that the fur seals have returned to Macquarie Island after having been virtually wiped out by the earlier sealers. The elephant seals were never exploited to the same extent and each year return to the Island in increasing numbers to breed and rear their pups. The film describes in detail the yearly cycle of the elephant seals on Macquarie Island.

results.title: The Seals at Point Lebatt [i.e. Labatt]
results.brief_description: The life of the seals at Point Labatt, South Australia where they come to breed and bring up their young. Contains underwater photography of seals playing and catching fish.

results.title: The Sealer
results.creator_credit: Kath Scholes, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Roger Scholes
results.brief_description: Depicts the events leading to a court enquiry in 1804 in Van Dieman’s Land into the abandoning of a sealing boat master who after having survived a year on a remote island in Bass Strait attempts to leave. Cast includes Peter Green, Yvette Isaacs.

results.title: The Seal watch with Bob Warneke
results.creator_credit: Robert Horne, Ken Taylor and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
This film, taken at the height of the breeding season of the seals in the Bass Strait, records the annual out-haul of the 800 lb weight territorial males and their violent battles for breeding territory. Included is the birth of a seal pup and a description of the challenges to its survival. Cinematography by Keith Taylor.
